summary.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).
The text is incomplete. See description of U2 and mention of missing folios.

msItem.title: Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram
msItem.filiation: Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: Bnf Indien 310; GOML D. 629 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 630); Mackenzie MSS n° 121 C. M. 42 and n° 122 C. M. 46 (see Taylor 1845, p. 57). As GOML D. 629 is also a Mackenzie MS, it might be identical with Mackenzie MS n° 122 C. M. 46.

support.p: The edges of f108‒f113 and f202‒f213 are rounded.

supportDesc.foliation: On the front woodcover: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1.

248 folios, Tamil foliation 1‒288 (f31, f63, f63, f65, f210‒f246 missing; f68‒f69 refoliated 67‒68; 2 folios foliated 69) = text (mūlam), 5 to 6 lines per page, by several hands (see fr288, rm), different from hand n° 1.
supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation, considering the age of the manuscript and in spite of bore holes caused by insects. Some folios are truncated.

additions.desc: U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: shelfmark. 11 and B/53.

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: title.
vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam

Front woodcover = title (part 1 of 2)
vaḷḷiyāmma- to be read with Back woodcover, which is inscribed:
ṉ pūrāṇam Thus:
vaḷḷiyāmmaṉ pūrāṇam [i.e. purāṇam] The front woodcover is further inscribed pu ta (in smaller letters), that is, puttakam (?).

U2, folio 1, recto and verso and folio 2, recto = incipit.: benediction and title in left margin; invocations (6 stanzas under chapter header Tōttiram; the phrase koṇṭalait tikaḻ at the beginning of stanza n° 1 is borrowed, it seems, from Tēvāram 2.38.3 stanza n° 4 being the Kāppu of the Kantapurāṇam) and benedictions.

encodingDesc.p: Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Transliteration conventions. Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
